commit 2e1f65aa006e56b8fd419e68cde971bf2200e8f4
Author: Walter Bender <walter@sugarlabs.org>
Date:   2014-04-30 14:36:19 -0400

    Don't offer to join beyond maximum participants
    
    This is patch checks to see how many participants are sharing an
    activity. If the maximum has been reached, then the Join palette menu
    item is not shown.
    
    This patch depends on two patches to sugar-toolkit-gtk3 (#138) that
    enable setting max_participants in activity.info and only impacts
    activities where that field has been set.
    
    Also, since we added caching of activity bundles in the toolkit, we
    take advantage of that caching in view/viewhelp.py,
    view/viewsource.py, and journal/misc.py to reduce file I/O.
    
    Replaces #339

10	3	src/jarabe/desktop/meshbox.py
3	3	src/jarabe/journal/misc.py
2	2	src/jarabe/view/viewhelp.py
4	4	src/jarabe/view/viewsource.py

commit 611c4770426b9da9960b51c3e08e7d061bfdf174
Merge: 947e3173 973b64e3

commit 973b64e3d082ce9fdc2203e05a3892f879b35b62
Merge: 947e3173 08b6edba
Author: Walter Bender <walter@sugarlabs.org>
Date:   2014-04-30 15:58:27 -0400

    Merge branch 'buddy-palette-nocache' of https://github.com/tchx84/sugar into tchx84-buddy-palette-nocache

commit 947e3173c6a31237c9bc30d8c58f97b2b618863a
Author: Walter Bender <walter@sugarlabs.org>
Date:   2014-04-30 14:56:44 -0400

    More robust locale matching
    
    The locale that is set by the manufacturing data can be of the format
    es_UY.UTF-8 where as the format of the locales we get from parsing
    available languages is es_UY.utf8
    
    This patch converts UTF-8 suffixes to utf8
    
    Note that this problem has only been observed on OLPC XO images. I was
    unsuccessful in convincing OLPC to change their rules for generating
    manufacturing data.
    
    Replaces PR #338

commit 08b6edba380e8e6a93dde63666668d980f5e2873
Author: Martin Abente Lahaye <tch@sugarlabs.org>
Date:   2014-04-30 11:25:37 -0400

    Do not cache BuddyMenu in favorites view
    
    Let BuddyMenu be created on-demand.
    
    Remove set_registered method, as this palette is now
    created on-demand, makes no sense to modify the current
    items as these will be set properly in the next
    initialization.
    
    Remove _palette_enabled as this is deprecated code
    from previous palette implementation.
    
    Remove self._register_menu and simplify code.
    
    This partch avoids #2184 issue for the buddy icon
    palette in favorites view.

commit fef65f87b0b163ca2a2d4711df23b6c59736d35d
Author: Martin Abente Lahaye <tch@sugarlabs.org>
Date:   2014-04-24 15:20:18 -0400

    Fix notification badges position and size
    
    Do not use unscaled magic numbers badge size and position,
    as this caused badges to look and locate differently with
    different SUGAR_SCALING values.
    
    Instead, honor Icon class _BADGE_SIZE for calculating the
    badge size.
    
    Also, locate the badge at the bottom-left corner of the icon.
    
    Signed-off-by: Martin Abente Lahaye <tch@sugarlabs.org>

commit c94e6f7d35e5f36a7dcd20cb28f830acf40bcf58
Author: Walter Bender <walter@sugarlabs.org>
Date:   2014-03-31 17:24:20 -0400

    Add control for microphone level setting
    This patch adds a microphone level and mute control to the speaker
    device on the Sugar Frame. It makes use of an extension to the sound
    model by Emil Dudev and a new icon, media-audio-input.svg in
    icons/scaleable/devices. (The extension to the sound model also
    requires a change in sugar-toolkit-gtk3 sugar3/acme-volume-alsa.c and
    sugar3/acme-volume-alsa.h).
    
    See [1] and [2] for the Design Team discussion.
    
    [1] http://wiki.sugarlabs.org/go/File:MicLevels.png
    [2] http://lists.sugarlabs.org/archive/sugar-devel/2014-March/047640.html
    
    Try 2: Some code consolidation by Martin and Gonzalo; rename
    speaker.py to audio.py
    
    Try 3: Remove unneed notification handlers that were interferring with
    GNOME/Sugar interactions. (Note that ASLAMIXER and Sugar interoperate
    properly with this patch.)
    
    Try 4: Martin added a class to the sound-capture code in model.py; UI
    logic clean-up.
    
    Try 5: Consolidated patch; includes patch by Gonzalo to fix grid padding
    
    Fixes SL #800

commit 9708bf42c0a5b126b30b426a545225b6a40747d0
Author: Walter Bender <walter@sugarlabs.org>
Date:   2014-03-26 18:20:41 -0400

    Replace journal filter combo boxes
    As per Feature [1], this patch replaces the filter combo boxes on the
    Journal toolbar with palettes. The raionale is that combo boxes don't
    work well when the option list is large. The palette is multicolumn
    (when needed), making selection much easier (especially on a touch screen).
    
    Note: There is a corresponding patch to sugar-artwork that introduces
    a change to settings (in order to enable "set_important", which
    positions a label next to a button icon on a toolbutton), a new icon
    (view-type), and a change to the gtk css definition for scrolled
    windows (to make them compatible with palette menu items).
    
    This PR has been revised from [2] in order to address an issue with the
    palette menu size as identified by Martin Abente.
    
    [1] http://wiki.sugarlabs.org/go/Features/Replace_combo_box_in_journal_search
    [2] sugarlabs#265
    
    Try2: Includes some consolidations recommended by Gonzalo and a patch to fix
    a problem with the width of the menu items
    
    Try3: Check toolbarbox size before setting "important"
    
    Try4: Reset palette widget after refresh (w/Martin Abente); update toolbar
    after allocate (w/Gonzalo Odiard)

387	127	src/jarabe/journal/journaltoolbox.py

commit 918606103b8aa6357a9a7cab826dfbcdc621f6a3
Author: Walter Bender <walter@sugarlabs.org>
Date:   2014-03-25 12:00:24 -0400

    Replace combobox with palettes on Language cpsection The Language-selection combobox does not work properly with touch and the long list of language and country-variants is almost impossible to use. (This is a revision of PR #279 -- as per the recommendation of Gonzalo, no ellipsis or max character width is used since we have ample room.)
    
    This patch does three things:
     (1) separates language selection from country selection, thus making
         the language list less unwieldy; and
     (2) replaces the combobox with a palette of menus.
     (3) cleans up some long-standing issues with locale processing in model.py
    
    Try-2: pyflakes cleanup; added touch-event in button label; improved
    processing of locales; remove unneed special cases for Pashto and
    Kreyol (w/Gonzalo Odiard)
    
    Try-3: Add back in Pashto and Kreyol as their removal caused some
    trouble on F18.
    
    Try-4: Code cleanup; removed unused constant; special-case USA; added
    event checking for touch
    
    Try-5: Fixed two typos
    
    The design has been discussed and reviewed [1, 2].

commit 736e477562019ba1141f2611203ac94b687e3c4a
Author: Martin Abente Lahaye <tch@sugarlabs.org>
Date:   2014-03-04 15:57:42 -0300

    Extend notifications model
    
    Add a buffer to the model. This buffer stores the notifications
    that are received from the DBus interface. These notifications
    are indexed by application name.
    
    Add a new signal for when a buffer is emptied, for an specific
    application name.
    
    Considering that the notifications are shown in UI elements such
    as Palettes, which are generated on demand, it is necessary to
    store notifications so they can be added later.
    
    Basically, this approach is follows a publisher and subscriber
    model.
    
    Signed-off-by: Martin Abente Lahaye <tch@sugarlabs.org>

4	0	src/jarabe/controlpanel/gui.py

commit 6b911a92312be756b5d0e695d9934070759a1911
Author: Martin Abente Lahaye <tch@sugarlabs.org>
Date:   2014-03-12 16:24:57 -0300

    Connect to same event once at a time from _Account
    
    After an _Account._connection is set, the _Account connects to
    'active-activity-changed' shell event. _Account._connection can
    later be drop and set to None. When _Account._connection is re-set,
    the _Account will re-connect to the same shell event without
    disconnecting from the previous one.
    
    Also, when _Account._connection is set to None, it makes no sense
    to continue handling that shell event, as there is no need to update
    the current active activity for that _Account.
    
    Therefore, make sure _Account connects to shell event only once at a
    time, and that it gets disconnected when _Account._connection is set
    to None.
    
    Signed-off-by: Martin Abente Lahaye <tch@sugarlabs.org>

18	6	src/jarabe/model/neighborhood.py

commit aa48bc1cfc7487d463efbea4e1549c929bc87e95
Author: Gonzalo Odiard <godiard@gmail.com>
Date:   2014-02-12 13:05:21 -0300

    Microformat updater: set cache header
    
    wiki.laptop.org, where the pages used to update the activities are
    located, usually serve old cached pages. We can avoid that
    setting the header Cache-Control' = 'max-age=600',
    and be sure the page is not older than 10 minutes.
    
    A reason to set this at client side, and not solve it only
    in wiki.laptop.org, is the posibility of intermnediate caches,
    as provider or school server proxies, or the use of other
    activities servers in particular deployments.
    
    Signed-off-by: Gonzalo Odiard <godiard@sugarlabs.org>

commit c7964abef18395b0a05ca479cadf21f7f1d9278b

commit 4154c440fb327de1ce0511753a04eaf4943a5b2a
Author: Frederick Grose <fgrose@sugarlabs.org>
Date:   2014-02-04 18:17:30 -0500

    Rework wireless control panel section to respect non-wireless connections
    
    Fixes #4410  https://bugs.sugarlabs.org/ticket/4410
    
    The 'Discard network history' button is peculiar to Sugar, and
    is destructive to all non-wireless connections, despite being in
    the 'Wireless' section of the control panel.
    
    Relabel the code variables and functions to be specific to
    wireless connections.
    
    Recode the functions to exclude non-wireless connections and
    include only 802-11-wireless or 802-11-olpc-mesh types.
    
    To minimize the chances that a manually created connection (such
    as 'Sugar Ad-hoc Network 2') is falsely white-listed as one of the
    Sugar internal ad hoc or olpc-mesh connections, each connection
    is tested against a discrete white list and specific to the
    wireless mode or connection type.
    
    Relabel the 'Radio' box instructions and 'Discard ...' button
    to avoid confusion over their state and actions.
    
    Feature description:
    https://wiki.sugarlabs.org/go/Features/Network_control_panel

42	6	extensions/cpsection/network/model.py
30	30	extensions/cpsection/network/view.py
1	25	src/jarabe/model/network.py

commit b4975cdcf57293a314b5adb4c4e192b3c0ae690f
Author: Gonzalo Odiard <godiard@gmail.com>
Date:   2014-01-31 11:58:33 -0300

    Inhibit suspend while doing text to speech
    
    When suspend/resume is enabled, and sugar is doing tts
    in a long text, suspend can make the computer sleep
    in the middle of the text.
    Having support to inhibit suspend/resume in the toolkit
    allow us to close this old OLPC ticket [1]
    
    [1] http://dev.laptop.org/ticket/11830
    
    Signed-off-by: Gonzalo Odiard <godiard@sugarlabs.org>

commit dc57288e0b863f762e5596f2c6ec4d3c65818ba5
Author: Walter Bender <walter@sugarlabs.org>
Date:   2014-01-20 14:42:16 -0500

    Add age and gender to user profile
    As per [1], this patch adds support for gender and age attributes to
    the user's profile. There are modifications to both the intro screens
    (gender and age selection are included after the user selects a color)
    and the AboutMe section of the Control Panel, which includes
    mechanisms for adjusting gender and age. The artwork used on these
    screens is added by [2]. Approved by the design team [3], although it seems there will be some delay in landing that after all [4]. A change to
    main.py is also included since there is now a UserProfile class.
    
    The gender and birth timestamp are stored gsettings as:
    
    /org/sugarlabs/user/gender
    /org/sugarlabs/user/birth-timestamp
    
    A unit test is included in a separate pull request [5].
    This request replaces pull requests 170, 199, 200, and 211.
    
    [1] http://wiki.sugarlabs.org/go/Features/About_Me
    [2] sugarlabs/sugar-artwork#23
    [3] http://meeting.sugarlabs.org/sugar-meeting/meetings/2014-01-07T22:18:04
    [4] sugarlabs/sugar-artwork#23 (comment)
    [5] sugarlabs#201

commit eb4f54947c871e66a271eda119d2fae578e8725d
Author: Manuel Quiñones <manuel.por.aca@gmail.com>
Date:   2014-01-14 10:54:58 -0300

    Icon API change: use pixel_size
    
    Instead of the deprecated icon_size.
    
    There are still places where Gtk.IconSize constants are used, in:
    
    - Gtk.Image.set_from_icon_name - still needs an icon size
    
    - Gtk.IconTheme.lookup_icon - the documentation is not clear in the
      'size' parameter, maybe we can move to pixel_size

commit aa13c9deb4b9569b4eccc194e991a2375d65c684
Author: Gonzalo Odiard <godiard@gmail.com>
Date:   2013-12-26 13:02:29 -0300

    Implement Activity Help feature
    
    A new shortcut (alt-shift-h) display a window with the help content
    available in Help activity. The document is based in the context,
    shell view or activity active. If not content is available nothing is
    shown.
    For activities with help content available, a menu is added in the palette
    in the activity icon at the top of the frame.
    
    Signed-off-by: Kalpa Welivitigoda <callkalpa@gmail.com>
    Signed-off-by: Gonzalo Odiard <gonzalo@laptop.org>

commit ad5292b309c63353037589cbc11d49901bab301c

1	0	po/POTFILES.in

commit ae54fc4e6d23a1b7f145810ea5e9edd12fa220bb
Author: Walter Bender <walter@sugarlabs.org>
Date:   2013-11-22 11:40:40 -0500

    Set limit to open activities and open instances
    At the request of OLPC AU (in an effort to reduce OOM freezes) this
    patch uses gconf to set a maximum number of open activities [1]. An
    alert is shown if the user tries to launch more activities than the
    maximum asking them to close an activity before opening a new one. If
    maximum_number_of_open_activites is not set or == 0, then there is no
    maximum limit applied.
    
    Further, Some activities don't behave well if more than one instance
    is open (e.g., SL #4554). This patch sets a limit on the number open
    instances of an activity based on a new field in activity.info:
    single_instance.
    
    If and only if single_instance = yes in activity.info, is it used to
    limit open instances to a single instance.
    
    NOTE: there is a patch to activitybundle.py in the toolkit necessary
    for this patch to be used.
    
    [1] /desktop/sugar/maximum_number_of_open_activities

12	0	data/sugar.schemas.in
7	0	src/jarabe/desktop/homewindow.py
4	2	src/jarabe/journal/expandedentry.py
4	2	src/jarabe/journal/journaltoolbox.py
3	1	src/jarabe/journal/listview.py

    flag, since it is a Linux file system. This patch checks to see if the

commit 14956762a18d34c8998cedaeb505d8606acddc9b
Author: Gonzalo Odiard <godiard@gmail.com>
Date:   2013-10-29 17:20:44 -0300

    Avoid switch to the Journal or change views when a modal window is opened - SL #4601
    
    If the user switch to the Journal when the Control Panel is opened
    using the hotkeys or the icon in the frame, when returns to the Home,
    the Contro Panel window is not show, but is focused, then the Home is useless.
    Trying to change views while the Control Panel is opened do not
    have any effect, then is disabled.
    
    This patch disable the keys F1 to F6 keys when the Control Panel is opened.
    
    Fixes - SL #4601
    
    Signed-off-by: Gonzalo Odiard <gonzalo@laptop.org>

commit dccca0fe5f16b64be35b80840763bb0ff3db6162
Author: Gonzalo Odiard <godiard@gmail.com>
Date:   2013-09-05 11:42:16 -0300

    Use focus-in/out events to set the visibility in the journal - SL# 4604
    
    The callback method of the signal 'visibility-notify-event' receive
    event.get_state() == None in the case of changing from the Journal to
    another activity, but not when changing to other views using F1, F2, F3.
    Use focus-in/focus-out events to set the visibility of the listview,
    because this works with realibility. Fixes #4604
    
    Signed-off-by: Gonzalo Odiard <gonzalo@laptop.org>

6	10	src/jarabe/journal/journalactivity.py

commit 0defde3f557515b4efe34d0708c65fa077fffa31
Author: Daniel Drake <dsd@laptop.org>
Date:   2013-09-04 13:15:17 -0600

    Initialise the DBus mainloop explicitly
    
    So that asynchronous messages and signals can be used, python-dbus must
    be initialised with a main loop. This currently happens because Sugar
    imports the datastore module at some point during startup.
    
    When working on some startup-time behaviour, this caught me out.
    Trying to work with dbus before that import had happened resulted in
    some really strange behaviour.
    
    Make the DBus mainloop assignment explicit to avoid this in future.

2	0	src/jarabe/main.py

    Microformat update: fix size lookup handling
    
    For a Downloader.get_size request, the size of the remote file is
    passed in the result parameter. Not sure why we were trying to call
    the result as if it were callable.
    
    Fixes a failure to update activities using the microformat updater.

commit fc19bbacadce7d49cbd379241cd12f0fcf4351b7
Author: Daniel Drake <dsd@laptop.org>
Date:   2013-09-02 09:06:42 -0600

    Updater: allow re-check after checking
    
    When opening the activity update control panel, closing it once the list
    of available updates has been presented, and then trying to open it again,
    we would be in STATE_CHECKED and try to check for updates again
    (i.e. refresh).
    
    This was causing an UpdaterStateException even though we can and should
    handle this simple refresh case.

1	1	src/jarabe/model/update/updater.py

commit 69961112e9dbdb79cbae06deb3d876dde74d33bc
Author: Manuel Quiñones <manuq@laptop.org>
Date:   2013-08-29 07:47:38 -0300

    SessionManager: make it work with web activities
    
    Fixes #4611 .
    
    SessionManager now sends a shutdown signal in each logout, shutdown or
    reboot.  Apisocket connects to this signal and sends the stop message
    to web activities, so they can do cleanup and store.
    
    SessionManager now uses the ShellModel to check if all activities have
    been removed.  If not, it tries again after one second for ten times.
    After that, it forces shutdown.
    
    SessionManager has been moved completly to the shell.  It was
    inheriting a counterpart class in the toolkit, but was the only
    consumer of that class.
    
    Journal is a special case.  It will not be destroyed automatically
    like other activities.  So we connect it to the SessionManager
    shutdown signal too, and destroy it in the callback.

    added to the buddy handle list.

commit 3ff0390431cfb44e86bb182386010d2628f1c7f6
Author: Walter Bender <walter@sugarlabs.org>
Date:   2013-08-16 13:34:23 -0400

    Load background section list store incrementally
    
    As per SL #245, some cpsections take a long time to load, leaving the
    user with the impression that something has gone wrong. This patch is
    specific to the background section: it is a refactoring of the code to
    load the list store, adding images one at a time, so the user sees
    that the widget is working. A busy cursor is also loaded.

commit 87e98af5b7fcff262d307e17ca2195664a342a67
Author: Manuel Quiñones <manuq@laptop.org>
Date:   2013-08-06 15:29:26 -0300

    Allow the web activity to finalize sending a stop notification
    
    Add a stop method to the shell model Activity.  It emits a stop signal
    for the Apisocket to handle it.  If no callback was connected or the
    callback doesn't return True, it closes the window.  So non-web
    activities continue behaving as before.
    
    Apisocket sends a stop notification to the web activity.  The web
    activity must send back a close request for Apisocket to close the
    window, thus completing the finalization.

9	0	src/jarabe/apisocket.py
15	1	src/jarabe/model/shell.py
1	1	src/jarabe/view/keyhandler.py
1	1	src/jarabe/view/palettes.py

commit 58fa64ba607c29dfd38698a84806b1e55cfcd93b
Author: Manuel Quiñones <manuq@laptop.org>
Date:   2013-08-02 20:23:19 -0300

    Send pause/resume notifications from the window manager to the web activity
    
    In the shell model for the activity: listen to changes in the state of
    the Wnck window and emit custom signals "pause" or "resume"
    accordingly.
    
    In the websocket API: connect to the model signals and send
    notifications to the web activity.  It follows the JSON-RPC protocol:
    a notification is similar to a request except for the id, which is not
    needed.

20	0	src/jarabe/apisocket.py
28	5	src/jarabe/model/shell.py

commit 4e00f22cbd14fda9cf9495f395e09f1b1879a254
Author: Manuel Quiñones <manuq@laptop.org>
Date:   2013-08-01 16:34:58 -0300

    apisocket: make classes inherit from object
    
    In Python 2 it is recommended to inherit from object, and the defined
    class is different if not doing so.  In Python 3 this was fixed.

4	4	src/jarabe/apisocket.py

5	0	src/jarabe/model/update/updater.py

commit 0f736e0cfe064e9fdeb1f9ab1f23683ef2817681
Author: Daniel Drake <dsd@laptop.org>
Date:   2013-07-09 11:20:30 -0600

    httprange: use Downloader class
    
    Increase code re-use by using the Downloader class instead of urllib2.
    The advantage here is that Soup keeps around connections for a while,
    so instead of re-creating TCP streams for each partial read, we just
    re-use the existing ones. This results in a noticable speedup when doing
    metadata lookups.
    
    Another advantage is that we can run the main loop while we are waiting
    for a response. This means that there is no need to create a separate
    thread for metadata lookups.

5	13	src/jarabe/model/update/microformat.py
5	1	src/jarabe/util/downloader.py
32	8	src/jarabe/util/httprange.py
2	2	tests/test_microformat.py

commit 06fbfec134f2d6aa93f725a0589bb7d99eabaa32
Author: Daniel Drake <dsd@laptop.org>
Date:   2013-07-08 13:05:53 -0600

    Microformat updater: use Downloader class
    
    Re-use the general downloader class for downloading activity
    metadata, which means that interrupted connections will now error
    and time out correctly.
    
    This involved adding a get_size() request to the downloader, and a
    got-chunk signal for users that don't require the entire download
    presented as a single buffer.

23	41	src/jarabe/model/update/microformat.py
33	5	src/jarabe/util/downloader.py
11	0	tests/test_downloader.py

commit 7d768d6436ea132fc5c597b32971326bd8ae1393
Author: Daniel Drake <dsd@laptop.org>
Date:   2013-07-08 11:43:45 -0600

    ASLO updater: use Downloader class
    
    Re-use the general downloader class for downloading activity
    metadata, which means that interrupted connections will now error
    and time out correctly.
    
    This involved adding a "download to memory" interface to the
    Downloader class, which has a new unit test.

10	40	src/jarabe/model/update/aslo.py
4	4	src/jarabe/model/update/updater.py
47	14	src/jarabe/util/downloader.py
16	5	tests/test_downloader.py

commit d43b926ffbe61da2400395be1fa09c0a5bc52892
Author: Daniel Drake <dsd@laptop.org>
Date:   2013-07-08 10:18:29 -0600

    Downloader: use Soup and set timeouts
    
    Downloading via GIO uses gvfs internally. Unfortunately gvfs does not
    set or handle connection timeouts, meaning that bad connectivity can
    lead to a total hang.
    
    Fixing gvfs is not easy:
    https://mail.gnome.org/archives/gvfs-list/2013-July/msg00000.html
    
    And while looking at the bug, I realised just how much overkill this
    is. gvfs runs in a separate process and does the HTTP communication,
    communicating back to gio over dbus, and has a few layers of abstraction.
    
    The gio developers on IRC recommended just to use libsoup directly,
    which is not hard. And we can set timeouts appropriately in order to
    handle bad connectivity.
    
    This required some tweaks to the internal Downloader API - we can now
    handle cancellation much more directly.

26	32	src/jarabe/model/update/updater.py
74	73	src/jarabe/util/downloader.py
71	0	tests/test_downloader.py

commit 5377d30eea57ca7458af238d0244f207fc062bcd

    Signed-off-by: Gonzalo Odiard <gonzalo@laptop.org>

commit 0827a64d479e426c496b3fa648a5c9b7bc70b174
Author: Gonzalo Odiard <godiard@gmail.com>
Date:   2013-07-09 07:37:52 -0300

    Clear query button should respect what_filter parameter
    
    When he ObjectChooser was opened filtering by a file type (e.g. Images),
    and the user filter something by text, and the query is empty,
    when the user press the button to clear the query,
    the initial filter should be respected.
    
    Signed-off-by: Gonzalo Odiard <gonzalo@laptop.org>

commit 2ffa1cf6742bdb6b70c470d21969b4f45568038e
Author: Walter Bender <walter@sugarlabs.org>
Date:   2013-06-29 06:30:24 -0400

    Add support for multiple homeviews
    
    This patch adds support for multiple home views as per [1]. The number
    of home views is determined by the list of VIEW_ICONS found in
    /desktop/sugar/desktop/view_icons. If no gconf entry is found,
    defaults from jarabe/desktop/config.py are used. The icons in the list
    are used both for the home view selection on the Home View toolbar and
    the favorites list in the Home List View. Just one home view, using
    the view-radial icon is used by default. Similarly, in the list view,
    the favorities icons are found in
    /desktop/sugar/desktop/favorite_icons. If not favorite icons are
    found, emblem-favorites is used.
    
    A unittest is included.
    
    [1] http://wiki.sugarlabs.org/go/Features/Multiple_home_views

    Microformat updater: skip name lookup for automated updates
    
    We normally go to some lengths to make sure that we present the
    localized activity name in the UI. However, if we are doing an
    automatic background update, there is no UI, so we can skip the
    online name lookup in cases where it would otherwise be necessary.

commit 90366afd86234d5ed627dbac1df1affeb407077c
Author: Daniel Drake <dsd@laptop.org>

    Move activity update code to jarabe.model
    
    In preparation for implementing automatic/background activity updates,
    move the code from an extension-specific model into jarabe.
    
    The main update code is now in jarabe.model.update and the downloader
    has been made generic and moved to jarabe.util.downloader. It now
    downloads files into the temporary 'data' directory which is cleaned up
    on every Sugar launch, avoiding leaving stale files around in failure
    cases.

commit 3668bbbd226362d3fe096e09be3e505c672a33e9
Author: Daniel Drake <dsd@laptop.org>
Date:   2013-06-19 13:31:19 -0600

    OLPC microformat activity updater
    
    Implement support for the widely-deployed OLPC activity microformat,
    according to
    http://wiki.sugarlabs.org/go/Features/Automatic_activity_updates
    
    A new helper class was added to be able to perform partial HTTP reads.
    When combined with the ZipFile class, we can download specific parts of
    zip archives without having to downloda the whole archive. We do this
    when we have to look up the localized activity name of a new activity.

    BundleUpdate work in terms of a bundle ID and name, rather than an
    installed Bundle.

commit 684ce9262e9483a6ab61b364d5ba5915b8139ba1

Date:   2013-06-17 16:01:41 -0600

    Activity updater: move activity check logic into backend
    
    Right now, the activity updater assumes that the backend requires one
    query per installed bundle. That won't be true for the OLPC microformat
    updater.
    
    Move the query-by-query checking logic into the ASLO backend, turning
    it into a class at the same time, in order to ease state tracking.

commit aea8c7b17590ed9cea4fc406d9dc40775d70cfef
Author: Daniel Drake <dsd@laptop.org>
Date:   2013-06-13 16:11:00 -0600

    Implement urgent background activity updates
    
    Dropping an empty .sugar-update flag file in the home directory will
    now trigger an automatic background activity update ran as soon as
    network connectivity is available.
    
    This is designed for use after a system upgrade. Upon major Sugar and OS
    upgrades, user activities will often need to be updated to new APIs, etc.
    The system upgrade tool should put this file in place, which will then
    trigger Sugar to try hard to update the user's activities.
    
    This replaces the previous use of the .sugar-update functionality,
    which was to show a message advising activity update, which turned out
    to be somewhat ineffective in the field.

0	52	src/jarabe/desktop/homebox.py
0	8	src/jarabe/main.py
4	0	src/jarabe/model/network.py
16	0	src/jarabe/model/update/updater.py

commit 2489917b7d6f3b72ccedc333028bdd12451c5474
Author: Daniel Drake <dsd@laptop.org>
Date:   2013-06-13 14:20:35 -0600

    Automatic activity updates
    
    A new auto_update_frequency gconf key (default 0, disabled) enables
    automatic activity update at an interval specified in days.
    
    Sugar checks if this threshold has been met 10 minutes after launch,
    and then every hour.
    
    Activity upgrades are done completely in the background, but if the
    user opens the updater control panel section while an update is in
    progress, the background update is effectively brought into the
    foreground and the user can monitor its progress.
    
    This required a bit of view/model rework so that the view can be regarded
    as a client that can attach at any point during the update process.

24	0	data/sugar.schemas.in
40	44	extensions/cpsection/updater/view.py

    updater: asynchronously update bundles
    
    This means that we unblock the main thread, a crucial step
    towards offering automatic background activity updates.

14	16	src/jarabe/model/update/updater.py

commit bd31295f7e4d79acdedbf9955711743b74ec3691
Author: Daniel Drake <dsd@laptop.org>
Date:   2013-06-10 15:20:20 -0600

    bundleregistry: Add asynchronous install capabilities
    
    In preparation for automatic activity updates, add asynchronous install
    capabilities to the bundleregistry.
    
    The synchronous install implementation has been removed and is now a user
    of the async API that waits for completion before returning.
    
    In order to avoid painful corner cases, the bundleregistry maintains
    a queue of bundles to install, and installs them one by one. Install is
    done in another thread to not block the main one.
    
    As the install thread requires brief access to the list of bundles in the
    bundle registry, all accesses to bundleregistry._bundles are now serialized
    with a lock.

188	48	src/jarabe/model/bundleregistry.py

commit 24f08b156465137455a7fdd78792d559a9530a87
Author: Daniel Drake <dsd@laptop.org>
Date:   2013-06-11 15:01:07 -0600

    Don't initialise GTK+/dbus thread support
    
    These calls allow GTK+ and dbus to be used from other threads.
    Sugar doesn't currently create any threads, so these calls aren't
    needed.
    
    This is useful for followup work where some main loop recursion
    results in a function that is sometimes called with the GDK threads lock
    held, and sometimes without it held. By disabling this threading support,
    this lock (and the surrounding headache) goes away.
    
    By not activating the threading lock, we should also have a minor
    performance increase.
    
    Threads can still be used if desired, but all GTK+ calls should be made
    from the main thread. These functions have actually been deprecated
    in GTK+ 3.6 as the developers have determined that "draw from one thread"
    is the way to go.
    
    The GLib.threads_init() call is still needed, as we do have users
    that work with threads, so the GIL must be released accordingly. However it
    can be removed once pygobject-3.10 is a requirement:
    https://bugzilla.gnome.org/show_bug.cgi?id=686914

3	4	src/jarabe/main.py

commit daec7e3883cd08555f6e817a7ee2faa9334a94ad
Author: Daniel Narvaez <dwnarvaez@gmail.com>
Date:   2013-06-27 15:47:26 +0200

    Implement only the test target, not check
    
    At the moment our tests requires to be run inside a clean
    dbus/xvfb session, which is not always available where the
    check target is used (for example in distcheck). Also when
    running distcheck in buildbot we don't really want to run
    tests again, since we just run them in the check step.
    
    We might revisit this in the future but using a non standard
    target is the easiest solution for now.

1	3	Makefile.am

commit 0cb27e1ce702166cd87af9d3f6173d28c3cb98ee
Author: Daniel Drake <dsd@laptop.org>
Date:   2013-06-07 13:52:29 -0600

    Move activity update code to jarabe.model
    
    In preparation for implementing automatic/background activity updates,
    move the code from an extension-specific model into jarabe.
    
    The main update code is now in jarabe.model.update and the downloader
    has been made generic and moved to jarabe.util.downloader. It now
    downloads files into the temporary 'data' directory which is cleaned up
    on every Sugar launch, avoiding leaving stale files around in failure
    cases.

commit 8148fdf96f58fa017e3a68dc7522ad994311a61e
Author: Daniel Drake <dsd@laptop.org>
Date:   2013-06-06 16:28:21 -0600

    Store content bundles in bundle registry
    
    Previously, only activity bundles were maintained in the bundle registry.
    Extend this to cover all kinds of "trackable" bundles, which in reality
    just means the addition of content bundles.
    
    This is needed in order to clean up the code and bundle API (as has happened
    here) and to allow content bundle updates through the updater control
    panel.

3	0	src/jarabe/desktop/activitieslist.py

commit fc58b41a9372b3761d63aa45c525645554f034c9
Author: Daniel Drake <dsd@laptop.org>
Date:   2013-06-06 15:32:02 -0600

    bundleregistry: Fix conflict between file monitoring and its own operations (#3707)
    
    When an activity is installed via bundleregistry, it is effectively
    registered twice: once by bundleregistry after installing it, and again
    when the file operations monitor picked up the event.
    
    This lead to error messages in the logs and occasional duplication
    of activity icons in the home view.
    
    Refactor the code slightly so that it is resilient and accepting that
    some activities may try to be registered twice. To avoid the duplication
    of icons, be more careful to only emit the bundle-added signal when we
    really add the bundle.
    
    Also clean up the installation of MIME types. The ActivityBundle class
    does this, so there is no need for bundleregistry to do so.

29	27	src/jarabe/model/bundleregistry.py

commit c6000c18d0b47e28b9f090cefd2ba1a8a2c3b4d3
Author: Daniel Drake <dsd@laptop.org>
Date:   2013-06-05 16:51:49 -0600

    Bundle registry: Cleanup/clarify bundle installation
    
    Management of bundle installs/upgrades was a mess, this attempts to
    clean it up and sort it out.
    
    It was not clear under which circumstances a bundle should be installed
    via the bundle object vs via the bundle registry. The logical answer here
    is that it should be done by the registry, so document why that is the case.
    
    In bundleregistry, upgrade() seemed like it should be used for bundle
    updates, but actually install() duplicated some of that logic in a slightly
    different way. Touch up the upgrade logic in install(), remove upgrade(),
    and add some documentation to make the situation clear.
    
    The install() API differed between JournalEntryBundle, ActivityBundle and
    ContentBundle. Eliminate the differences. JEB uid's are now stored at
    initialization time, and the Bundle classes themselves choose the install
    path (this does not vary when activities are installed this way).
    
    The journal had two codepaths that dealt with activity installation/upgrade
    (on arrival of the bundle in the datastore, and on resume)); unite them into
    one and update for the above changes.

9	3	src/jarabe/journal/journalentrybundle.py
89	70	src/jarabe/journal/misc.py
75	45	src/jarabe/model/bundleregistry.py

commit 31a8b8bc5bf574232c303cd43308b13e196f1724
Author: Gonzalo Odiard <godiard@gmail.com>
Date:   2013-06-18 18:46:04 -0300

    Implement filter by mime types used by activities in the objectchooser
    
    Add a optative parameter filter_type to ObjectChooser constructor.
    Constants to define the different filter types are defined in
    sugar-toolkit-gtk3 patch. If is equals to 'mime_by_activity'
    the parameter what_filter should be a bundle_id,
    and the filter will be set to the collection of mime types
    the activity can manage, as configured in the activity.info file.
    
    The title in the toolbar is changed, and the what_filter combo
    is not visible when this parameter is used.
    
    If filter_type have a invalid value, a exeception is throw,
    if is not used, the filter type is guessed based on the what_filter
    parameter as before.
    
    A example of use is:
    
    from sugar3.graphics.objectchooser import ObjectChooser
    from sugar3.graphics.objectchooser import FILTER_TYPE_MIME_BY_ACTIVITY
    
    chooser = ObjectChooser(parent=self, what_filter=self.get_bundle_id(),
                            filter_type=FILTER_TYPE_MIME_BY_ACTIVITY)
    
    This patch need a change in sugar-toolkit-gtk3 because a parameter was
    added.
    
    As this change modify the dbus signature, a dbus method was added,
    keeping the old one for backward compatibility, for use of non python
    activities.
    
    Signed-off-by: Gonzalo Odiard <gonzalo@laptop.org>

20	0	src/jarabe/journal/journalactivity.py
45	7	src/jarabe/journal/journaltoolbox.py
15	5	src/jarabe/journal/objectchooser.py

commit 664b914ec43186d50e1fc8c3271d15830f71b47e
Author: Walter Bender <walter@sugarlabs.org>
Date:   2013-06-20 08:25:13 -0400

    Add webaccount/webservice extension support
    
    This is another patch in a series of patches for interacting with
    online accounts from Sugar.  The relevant feature request is [1].
    
    This patch introduces two new sections in sugar extensions:
    
    (1) webservice is stub for installing webservices; each web service is
    installed in a subdirectory of this directory.
    
    (2) cpsection/webaccount is a new control panel section for managing
    web service accounts. Account management services are loaded into
    individual subdirectories of cpsection/webaccount/services.
    
    A new helper method was also added to
    jarabe/webservice/accountsmanager and the unit test as updated accordingly.
    
    Note that this same directory structure can be set up in
    env.get_profile_path()/extensions for web services installed by the
    end user.
    
    [1] http://wiki.sugarlabs.org/go/Features/Web_services
    
    A first pass at a unit test for the new webaccount cpsection is also
    included. For naming consistency, this test was called test_webaccount
    while the exsiting test_webaccount was renamed to the more appropriate
    test_webservice.

commit 8a6387ea2bf6b3a7560c3b78adb3151de2dbc9de
Author: Walter Bender <walter@sugarlabs.org>
Date:   2013-06-19 14:41:17 -0400

    Support webservice repository
    
    This patch is a refactoring of the accounts manager for webservices to
    enable services to be installed in both /usr/share/sugar/extensions
    and env.get_profile_path()/extensions. There is a complexity is due to
    an issue with a collision of namespace; hence a repository of loaded
    modules is maintained to help disambiguate sevices installed in the
    two places.
    
    The unit test has been updated to reflect these changes.

commit 7440d187995995ef8b10bd4fe690062b54822012
Author: Gonzalo Odiard <godiard@gmail.com>
Date:   2013-06-18 14:32:33 -0300

    Avoid executing the query two times at ObjectChooser startup
    
    The object chooser was setting at initialization properties
    in the MainToolbox. Every set triggered a query change,
    setting both parameters simultaneously, the query is executed
    only one time. This reduce ObjectChooser startup time,
    specially with big Journals.
    
    Signed-off-by: Gonzalo Odiard <gonzalo@laptop.org>

commit 2c271a903e6669ca51ef5045ca2e6f987c4d0a94
Author: Walter Bender <walter@sugarlabs.org>
Date:   2013-06-14 16:37:18 -0400

    Add menu items to journal palettes for webservices
    
    This patch adds UI support for interacting with online accounts from Sugar.
    The relevant feature request is [1].
    
    The new UI elements are added to the Sugar Journal Detail View toolbar:
    (1) webservices are added to the Journal list view Copy-to palette and
    to the similar palette on the Journal detail view toolbar.
    (2) A palette of refresh buttons for all webservices are also added to
    the Journal detail view toolbar. These buttons are enabled when the
    webservice is active and insensitive when the webservice is inactive.
    It also adds a new UI element to the Sugar List View palette: webservices
    are added to the Journal list view Copy-to palette.
    
    [1] http://wiki.sugarlabs.org/go/Features/Web_services
    
    A new unit test in included in a separate patch.

34	0	src/jarabe/journal/journaltoolbox.py
5	0	src/jarabe/journal/palettes.py

commit 6d226a77efd25284f433dc4f39d744560cc1174d
Author: Walter Bender <walter@sugarlabs.org>
Date:   2013-06-14 14:29:36 -0400

    Add menu items to journal palettes for webservices
    
    This patch adds UI support for interacting with online accounts from Sugar.
    The relevant feature request is [1].
    
    The new UI elements are added to the Sugar Journal Detail View toolbar:
    (1) webservices are added to the Journal list view Copy-to palette and
    to the similar palette on the Journal detail view toolbar.
    (2) A palette of refresh buttons for all webservices are also added to
    the Journal detail view toolbar. These buttons are enabled when the
    webservice is active and insensitive when the webservice is inactive.
    It also adds a new UI element to the Sugar List View palette: webservices
    are added to the Journal list view Copy-to palette.

commit 14659c2ef2948c2d52908e9f2ac476ab72369613
Author: Walter Bender <walter@sugarlabs.org>
Date:   2013-06-09 06:55:49 -0400

    Add online service support
    
    This patch adds a new section to sugar/src/jarabe to manage web services.
    
    The relevant feature request is [1].
    
    Adds a new web section of jarabe is for a prototype of a new online
    account management class that manages the services described above.
    The services themselves are intended to be kept in subdirectors of
    sugar/extensions/web and are the subject of a separate patch. Also
    in a separate patch will be a UI extention to the Journal toolbar and
    palette, adding new menuitems.
    
    (Includes a unit test)
    
    [1] http://wiki.sugarlabs.org/go/Features/Web_services

commit de87d97df7dd48288bda14c8ffc467d635d30ee4
Author: Walter Bender <walter@sugarlabs.org>
Date:   2013-06-08 09:18:45 -0400

    Set HIDDEN attribute on .Sugar-Metadata directory
    
    According to the OLPC AU dpeloyment [1], 50% of the support calls they
    get from teachers are due to a confusion caused by looking in the
    .Sugar-Metadata directory for files from Windows. "On Windows, the
    directory is not hidden, and people are going into it expecting their
    files to be in there. What's even more confusing is that the filenames
    they are looking for are indeed inside, but those are metadata and not
    the actual files."
    
    This patch uses a new Sugar extension, sugar-fatattr, to set the
    HIDDEN attribute on the .Sugar-Metadata directory.[2]
    
    [1] http://sugardextrose.org/issues/1367
    [2] sugarlabs/sugar-toolkit-gtk3#33

8	0	src/jarabe/journal/model.py

Date:   2013-06-04 14:17:45 +0200

    Tweaks to the datastore API
    
    load_data is renamed load and also passes metadata
    create does not send the data

    The main goal is to allow creating objects with no data.

commit 72a22523d126ce9e77b6f402bb9eab2f9bac687e

13	0	src/jarabe/apisocket.py

commit 6401a73c455d9d87cba22b69e0671fb2836c6e10
Author: Daniel Narvaez <dwnarvaez@gmail.com>
Date:   2013-06-02 16:03:45 +0200

    Rework responses to datastore API calls
    
    We are now responding the main call immediately. If we fail
    to write to update the datastore, we just return an error to
    the stream close call.
    
    This will allow to simplify the javascript API. The double
    datastore call on create is unfortunate but I prefer to keep
    the API clean of sugar specific limitations, we can fix the
    implementation later if necessary.

38	14	src/jarabe/apisocket.py

commit 38f451b487bb493abcba12c198e96042d3ca2731
Author: Daniel Narvaez <dwnarvaez@gmail.com>
Date:   2013-06-01 23:27:28 +0200

    Consistently respond with an array
    
    This is taken from jsonrpc and it's because you might
    have multiple arguments in the response callback.

    to get them separately because loading the data is

commit e2a118c548fca192a6736ca279e3befc4e2a3f22
Author: Daniel Narvaez <dwnarvaez@gmail.com>
Date:   2013-05-21 00:44:36 +0200

    Add support for SUGAR_RUN_TEST variable
    
    When set the sugar shell runs a subprocess with
    the command line specified by the variable, watches
    it and exits with the same status code.
    
    This will make it easy to run tests inside the shell
    environment, html activity tests in particular.

    html activities.

commit e6bb26ff6a7cb76227370de4777b14314b7d61cc
Author: Daniel Narvaez <dwnarvaez@gmail.com>
Date:   2013-05-18 14:08:11 +0200

    Don't lint config.py
    
    It's autogenerated and the paths can be an arbitrary. So it can
    overflow line length depending on where you install it. Fortunately
    there is not much to lint in config.py.
    
    I'm doing this using flake8 because the pep8 exclude option is not
    very good and doing this in the code is nicer anyway. flake8 runs
    both pyflakes and pep8, adding extension support and the ability
    to exclude lines and entire files.

1	2	Makefile.am
1	1	src/jarabe/config.py.in

0	1	extensions/cpsection/modemconfiguration/model.py

commit 4ad2a5c23df7980a86a8be806dd19a778ba2aabb
Author: Walter Bender <walter@sugarlabs.org>
Date:   2013-05-12 18:02:45 -0400

    Return modem_settings from the _secrets_cb
    
    Modem configuration uses Gtk.main_iteration() in a loop waiting for the
    asynchronous call to get_secrets to return. This causes a problem with
    the GLib.idle_add call in the gui to set the WATCH cursor (See #3800).
    
    This patch uses a callback in the _secrets_cb (and _secrets_err_cb) to
    return the settings, thus avoiding the need for the loop.

12	15	extensions/cpsection/modemconfiguration/model.py
9	6	extensions/cpsection/modemconfiguration/view.py

commit c7fbc66b6aeb960831c8e334fadf51fa557e9416
Author: Walter Bender <walter.bender@gmail.com>
Date:   2013-05-02 20:11:37 -0400

    Complete port to introspection; fix problem with language setting
    
    This series of patches completes the conversion to intropection for
    the keyboard section of the Sugar control panel. The issues were: (1)
    conversion to XKL (import xklavier was causing Sugar to crash); (2)
    work-around for the problem with gconf get_list and set_list (dnarvaez
    added a Sugar extention to enable set_list to save a list of keyboard
    layouts); and (3) fixing a problem with setting the proper default
    languages in the UI.
    
    Part 3 requires a conversion from ISO-639 2-character codes to ISO-639
    3-character codes. This is accomplished by making use of a table
    available at:
    http://www.loc.gov/standards/iso639-2/ISO-639-2_utf-8.txt
    A snapshot of this table is now included in sugar/data.

486	0	data/ISO-639-2_utf-8.txt
1	0	data/Makefile.am
41	29	extensions/cpsection/keyboard/model.py
86	35	extensions/cpsection/keyboard/view.py

commit 82c16b4a5fe8b42e9728b3b77ef561957202bb44
Author: Walter Bender <walter.bender@gmail.com>
Date:   2013-04-30 19:41:00 -0400

    Add alpha UI for background cp section
    
    This patch exposes to the UI control over the alpha level of the
    background image.  It supports levels of 20% 40% 60% 80% and 100%
    (utilizing the icons from the network view).  Because there is no 25%
    icon, I made 20% be the default level.

29	2	extensions/cpsection/background/view.py

commit 6ad1e1fa40648a0bb85bbae1939308ff3e5fbf8a
Author: Walter Bender <walter.bender@gmail.com>
Date:   2013-04-29 16:45:28 -0400

    Add background image to homeview
    
    Implement background image feature as per [1]. The patch adds
    homebackgroundbox.py and introduces a new control panel widget for
    selecting a background image.
    
    Some details:
    
    (1) Two gconf settings are used to tell homebackgroundbox.py which
    image to use for the background and what alpha setting to use when
    rendering the image.
    
    (2) Currently the control panel widget only allows the user to set the
    background image; a reasonable default alpha setting (75%) is used.
    
    (3) The images available for the background are looked for recursively
    in ~/Documents and /usr/share/backgrounds .
    
    (4) The gconf setting is being monitored by the background box, so
    updating the setting automatically updates the background.
    
    Future enhancement: expose some mechanism for setting the alpha of the
    background.
    
    This series of patches is based on the work of Agustin Zubiaga.
    
    [1] http://wiki.sugarlabs.org/go/Features/Background_image_on_home_view

1	0	configure.ac
1	1	extensions/cpsection/Makefile.am
6	0	extensions/cpsection/background/Makefile.am
21	0	extensions/cpsection/background/__init__.py
108	0	extensions/cpsection/background/model.py
112	0	extensions/cpsection/background/view.py
1	0	src/jarabe/desktop/Makefile.am
105	0	src/jarabe/desktop/homebackgroundbox.py
2	1	src/jarabe/desktop/homewindow.py

commit c1dab7af26bea8a2a7df371b887f3b56014f9482
Author: Simon Schampijer <simon@laptop.org>
Date:   2013-04-25 12:35:48 +0200

    Use the GLib.MAXINT32 instead of GObject.G_MAXINT32
    
    G_MIN/MAX constants had been moved into GObject overrides
    (See pygobject c2aa6f0d0ed4c4e60f081b106dc7a65513963fce) but
    it is recommended to use the constants from GLib as those
    are pulled in directly from GI.
    
    Acked-by: Manuel Quiñones <manuq@laptop.org>

commit 5847ca47825dcfdbbb57c367f9e739e1450f3aaa
Author: Manuel Quiñones <manuq@laptop.org>
Date:   2013-04-16 08:55:14 -0300

commit 739bc84a953c80fbf32ce357405857868f5a611c
Author: Manuel Quiñones <manuq@laptop.org>
Date:   2013-04-10 16:12:44 -0300

    Journal: fix the API for drag and drop - SL #3999
    
    TestCase:
    
    - open Paint activity, draw something
    - go to the Journal
    - drag the Paint entry to the Documents drive
    - insert a USB stick
    - drag the Paint entry to the USB drive
    
    The paint should be in Documents and in the stick
    
    Note: this needs the upstream fix
    https://bugzilla.gnome.org/show_bug.cgi?id=692844 which is not in GTK+
    3.6 but is added in current olpc builds as gtk3-3.6.4.1.fc18.olpc2.
    So it can be tested on an XO.
    
    Note: this does not fix the unwanted palette popup as described in the
    ticket.  That will be a separate patch.
    
    Signed-off-by: Manuel Quiñones <manuq@laptop.org>

commit 6fd6218128c17b5253d559c5869bf21afd2d1fc4
Author: Manuel Quiñones <manuq@laptop.org>
Date:   2013-04-10 08:17:31 -0300

    Bring back dragging of elements from the clipboard to the activities - SL #4485
    
    This is another API fix for code not yet ported to GTK+3, similar
    to #3819:
    
    - gtk.SelectionData.type  ->  Gtk.SelectionData.get_data_type()
    - context.set_icon_pixbuf(...)  ->  Gtk.drag_set_icon_pixbuf(context, ...) [2]
    
    [1] https://developer.gnome.org/gtk3/3.5/gtk3-Selections.html#gtk-selection-data-get-data-type
    [2] https://developer.gnome.org/gtk3/stable/gtk3-Drag-and-Drop.html#gtk-drag-set-icon-pixbuf
    
    Signed-off-by: Manuel Quiñones <manuq@laptop.org>

commit 0aca8e59caa26d055debe6f92689c0031790c6f6
Author: Manuel Quiñones <manuq@laptop.org>
Date:   2013-04-02 22:56:05 -0300

    Bring back dragging of elements from the activities to the frame clipboard - SL #3819
    
    TestCase:
    
    - open an activity like Browse, Read, Log (not Write, is a special case)
    - bring up the frame
    - drag things to the left side panel of the frame (images, links, or selected text)
    
    The elements should be added to the clipboard which is inside the
    panel.  They should have the proper icon and they should popup a
    palette to act on them.
    
    Note: if the dragged object is a link from Browse, Sugar tries to copy
    the html to the disk.  But the current implementation looks wrong.  I
    have opened #4477 to track it: http://bugs.sugarlabs.org/ticket/4477
    
    Note: this doesn't solve the inverse operation: drag from the
    clipboard to the activity.  This will be done in another patch.
    
    API fixes:
    
    - gtk.SelectionData.type  ->  Gtk.SelectionData.get_data_type().name() [1]
    - gtk.SelectionData.data  ->  Gtk.SelectionData.get_data() [2]
    - gtk.SelectionData.target  ->  Gtk.SelectionData.get_target() [3]
    - context.targets  ->  context.list_targets() [4]
    - context.drop_finish(...)  ->  Gdk.drop_finish(context, ...) [5]
    - context.drag_status(...)  ->  Gdk.drag_status(context, ...) [6]
    - context.get_source_widget()  ->  Gdk.drag_get_source_widget(context) [7]
    
    [1] https://developer.gnome.org/gtk3/3.5/gtk3-Selections.html#gtk-selection-data-get-data-type
    [2] https://developer.gnome.org/gtk3/3.5/gtk3-Selections.html#gtk-selection-data-get-data
    [3] https://developer.gnome.org/gtk3/3.5/gtk3-Selections.html#gtk-selection-data-get-target
    [4] https://developer.gnome.org/gdk/stable/gdk-Drag-and-Drop.html#gdk-drag-context-list-targets
    [5] https://developer.gnome.org/gdk/stable/gdk-Drag-and-Drop.html#gdk-drop-finish
    [6] https://developer.gnome.org/gdk/stable/gdk-Drag-and-Drop.html#gdk-drag-status
    [7] https://developer.gnome.org/gtk3/stable/gtk3-Drag-and-Drop.html#gtk-drag-get-source-widget
    
    The type of Gtk.SelectionData now comes as a Gdk.Atom instead of
    string.  We use the name of the type to keep our code working.
    
    The data for the type 'text/uri-list' comes with a character '\x00' at
    the end now.  But using SelectionData.get_uris() returns a proper list
    (thanks to Flavio Danesse for the recommendation).  So we can use that
    list instead of doing selection.get_data().split('\n') or
    sugar3.mime.split_uri_list (which could be obsolete now).  In fact,
    this change was made a while ago in clipboardpanelwindow.py, but not
    in clipboardtray.py.  See commit f0d194f3 .
    
    Signed-off-by: Manuel Quiñones <manuq@laptop.org>

2	2	src/jarabe/frame/clipboardmenu.py
2	2	src/jarabe/frame/clipboardobject.py
1	1	src/jarabe/frame/clipboardpanelwindow.py
22	16	src/jarabe/frame/clipboardtray.py

commit d513315fcac11dc228f04fbff69696beaf72fbd3
Author: Martin Pitt <martinpitt@gnome.org>
Date:   2013-03-21 14:56:24 +0100

    Session: Properly check for logind
    
    session.py talks to logind, so it needs to specifically check if logind is
    running. /sys/fs/cgroup/systemd will be present also when systemd was built
    without logind (--disable-logind).
    
    For details, see:
    <https://mail.gnome.org/archives/desktop-devel-list/2013-March/msg00092.html
    
    Acked-by: Simon Schampijer <simon@laptop.org>

1	1	src/jarabe/model/session.py

commit 5b2c88b621d684d8631655fb5fab03fc70fbd2bf
Author: Simon Schampijer <simon@laptop.org>
Date:   2013-03-21 11:58:11 +0100

    documents dir: handle cases where get_documents_path returns None, SL #4380
    
    I came across this when the Palettes in the Journal where not able
    to be displayed because the code to add the copy to documents option
    was failing hard because get_documents_path returned None.
    
    The root cause on my system is that I have wiped the Documents folder and
    xdg-user-dir returns $HOME as a consequence which we ommit in
    get_documents_path.
    
    This patch does gracefully handle those cases in a few places, including
    the Palettes. In the volumes toolbar we were already doing so.
    
    Signed-off-by: Simon Schampijer <simon@laptop.org>
    Acked-by: Manuel Quiñones <manuq@laptop.org>

2	1	src/jarabe/journal/journaltoolbox.py

2	1	src/jarabe/journal/palettes.py

commit 2577166a9ec64ee2a16abf61397bd75bc279984d
Author: Simon Schampijer <simon@laptop.org>
Date:   2013-03-14 12:13:51 +0100

    TransitionBox: replace the CanvasIcon with an Icon, part of SL #4221
    
    The icon in the transition box does not need to be a canvas icon
    that reacts to input. It can be an icon only. That helps us to
    not trigger any visual hover feedback for that icon.
    
    Signed-off-by: Simon Schampijer <simon@laptop.org>
    Acked-by: Manuel Quiñones <manuq@laptop.org>

5	3	src/jarabe/desktop/transitionbox.py

commit 692c95f3fc673e039e56ab1f4ae538964031db89
Author: Walter Bender <walter.bender@gmail.com>
Date:   2013-02-25 08:08:35 -0500

    Control Panel: handle switching between landscape and portrait mode, SL #4444
    
    When the control panel is opened for the first time, a table is
    generated with a number of columns based on screen width. If the
    screen is subsequently rotated, the column number is no longer
    correct. In addition, the scrolled window holding the table needs to
    be resized so that it fits on the screen.
    
    This patch removes the section icons and sets it up again to
    recompute the number of columns and to resize the window and
    it's containing table.
    
    Signed-off-by: Walter Bender <walter.bender@gmail.com>
    Signed-off-by: Manuel Quiñones <manuq@laptop.org>
    Acked-by: Simon Schampijer <simon@laptop.org>

17	7	src/jarabe/controlpanel/gui.py

commit 158f4384d1f3423a6c2063723434f4f331796f81
Author: Simon Schampijer <simon@laptop.org>
Date:   2013-02-19 10:10:45 +0100

    Journal toolbar: add tooltip to favorite filter
    
    This patch adds the tooltip 'Favorite entries' to the favorite filter
    button in the Journal toolbar. The button is a ToggleToolButton and
    with the recent change in the toolkit-gtk3 63b8e87b1a99a854e9adbb1579b1e05244d2dc4
    we do hide the tooltip when the button is clicked or touched.
    
    This adds a new string, therefore this patch is only applied to
    master. The addition and string has been discussed with Gary
    and Manuel.
    
    Signed-off-by: Simon Schampijer <simon@laptop.org>

commit 976c3f5ef1202d586f65d90d959d123d33d70e07
Author: Simon Schampijer <simon@laptop.org>
Date:   2012-12-11 21:10:58 +0100

    Frame, Wireless Device icon: use the same status code as the newtworkview has, call update_color - SL #4188
    
    Using the same code to indicate connection status as the
    WirelessNetworkView, and calling update_color as WirelessNetworkView
    does too, this fixes the issue described in SL #4188.
    
    Signed-off-by: Simon Schampijer <simon@laptop.org>
    Signed-off-by: Manuel Quiñones <manuq@laptop.org>

5	2	extensions/deviceicon/network.py

commit 7b118678414a7221fe844031bbdd5941b2094d0f
Author: Simon Schampijer <simon@laptop.org>
Date:   2013-02-15 13:53:05 +0100

    Journal sorting button: hide/show on click or touch
    
    Using the 'toggle_palette' property of the Palette invoker
    we get the behaviour for hiding/showing the Palette when
    clicking or touching the button. We need to set the
    'hide_tooltip_on_click' property of the ToolButton to False
    in that case. This is the same behaviour as the Frame icons,
    see the WirelessDeviceView for a similar case of a ToolButton
    with that behaviour.
    
    Signed-off-by: Simon Schampijer <simon@laptop.org>
    Acked-by: Manuel Quiñones <manuq@laptop.org>

3	5	src/jarabe/journal/journaltoolbox.py

commit f6ba32cef3bbbc66fbf85e069fbb08d6c311fca6
Author: Manuel Quiñones <manuq@laptop.org>
Date:   2013-02-14 10:46:05 +0100

    ObjectChooser: make ObjectChooser transient for the parent window
    
    There are two set-transient-for for methods: one that expects the
    window and parent parameter to be of type GtkWindow [1] and one that
    expects them to be of type GdkWindow [2].
    
    The parent window we get for the object chooser is of type GdkWindow
    as we use GdkX11.X11Window.foreign_new_for_display to construct it
    from the xid passed from the toolkit.
    
    This patch changes the code to use gdk_window_set_transient_for in
    this case.
    
    [1] http://developer.gnome.org/gtk3/3.4/GtkWindow.html#gtk-window-set-transient-for
    [2] http://developer.gnome.org/gdk3/stable/gdk3-Windows.html#gdk-window-set-transient-for
    
    Signed-off-by: Manuel Quiñones <manuq@laptop.org>
    Acked-by: Simon Schampijer <simon@laptop.org>

1	1	src/jarabe/journal/objectchooser.py

6	3	src/jarabe/main.py

commit ea803cb709587d506434e09c37fe9f4dfd2128d8
Author: Daniel Narvaez <dwnarvaez@gmail.com>
Date:   2013-01-22 13:10:37 +0100

    Rework how we select the Xcursor theme
    
    Metacity reads the default theme from gsettings and we were trying
    to override it at lower level, causing race conditions. Now we are
    just setting the cursor-theme gsetting, so that metacity setup the
    Sugar theme for us.
    
    Distributions which are shipping both GNOME and Sugar should make
    sure to set XDG_CONFIG_HOME for either of the desktops to point
    to a non default location, so that the settings are not conflicting.
    It's necessary in this case if you don't want to get the Sugar
    cursors in GNOME, but it seems like a sane approach in general. We
    are sharing several components with GNOME which are (or might in
    the future) use GNOME gsettings.
    
    Acked-by: Simon Schampijer <simon@laptop.org>

0	2	bin/sugar.in
4	10	src/jarabe/main.py

    Move metacity invocation into the python code
    
    So that the sugar script only setup environment variables
    and all the rest is in main.py. This avoids the confusion about
    putting stuff in the one or the other script. Ideally we would
    get rid of the bash script completely, but it would not be
    possible to source the debug and i18n files from python.
    
    Acked-by: Simon Schampijer <simon@laptop.org>

commit 8c48641642080d72acb2c95ef6624d27d2f31724

0	20	src/jarabe/frame/clipboardmenu.py

commit c62c8dab72eee975593765d8cabb799da92eb5c7
Author: Simon Schampijer <simon@laptop.org>
Date:   2012-12-21 10:49:23 +0100

    Journal: fix copy to clipboard functionality, part of #4307
    
    gtk_clipboard_set_with_data expects us to pass a data argument [1]. As the
    tempory file path we do copy to the clipboard is already part of the model
    we can set this to None as we can access that in the get_func and
    clear_func.
    
    The targets have to be of type GtkTargetEntry.
    
    [1] http://developer.gnome.org/gtk3/3.4/gtk3-Clipboards.html#gtk-clipboard-set-with-data
    [2] http://developer.gnome.org/gtk3/3.4/gtk3-Selections.html#GtkTargetEntry
    
    Signed-off-by: Simon Schampijer <simon@laptop.org>
    Reviewed-by: Daniel Drake <dsd@laptop.org>

2	2	src/jarabe/journal/palettes.py

commit ea4cb79fed67e41f695420d8a41dfdacc7bd3212
Author: Manuel Quiñones <manuq@laptop.org>
Date:   2012-12-18 18:09:48 -0300

    ClipboardIcon: API fixes for the Gtk.Clipboard set_with_data get_func callback - SL #4307
    
    - Gtk.SelectionData, selection.get_target() instead of selection.target
    
    - Gtk.TargetEntry, target.target instead of target[0]
    
    - Gtk.TargetEntry.target is a string representation of the target
      type, so to compare them with the selection target, which is a
      Gdk.Atom [1], we need to convert the latter to str like:
      str(selection.get_target())
    
    [1] http://developer.gnome.org/gtk3/stable/gtk3-Selections.html#GtkSelectionData-struct
    
    Signed-off-by: Manuel Quiñones <manuq@laptop.org>
    Acked-by: Simon Schampijer <simon@laptop.org>

7	4	src/jarabe/frame/clipboardicon.py

Author: Simon Schampijer <simon@laptop.org>

1	1	configure.ac

commit d0a5c110a1e47710946f530deb6707788a86b85c
Author: Manuel Kaufmann <humitos@gmail.com>
Date:   2012-12-10 18:34:57 -0300

    Avoid collisions with central buddy SL #3944
    
    When a collision is detected:
    
     - if one of the icons is locked, just add the other (free) one to the
       collision list
    
     - if no one of them are locked, add both to the collision list
    
    This decrease the possibility to collide with locked icons because
    they (the icons who collide) are added to the collision list and then
    '__solve_collisions_cb' is called to try to re-organize them.
    
    Signed-off-by: Manuel Kaufmann <humitos@gmail.com>
    Acked-by: Manuel Quiñones <manuq@laptop.org>

1	1	src/jarabe/desktop/grid.py

    are expanded horizontally to fit the column width.

commit d7ea8570b1da8f81aebf5df19e26bab003884d1b
Author: Manuel Kaufmann <humitos@gmail.com>
Date:   2012-12-05 18:00:32 -0300

    Fix the port of the filetransfer, SL #4242
    
     - Fix some issues related to the port to Gio (introspected): argument
       numbers and order and method names.
    
     - Use 'Gio.InputStream.read_bytes_async'[1] and
       'Gio.OutputStream.write_bytes_async' instead of '.read_async'[2] and
       'write_async' to transfer the data.
    
       This is done because there is no way to pass the correct buffer
       argument to those functions from Python. So, Gio provides those helper
       functions.
    
       [1] http://developer.gnome.org/gio/stable/GInputStream.html#g-input-stream-read-bytes-async
       [2] http://developer.gnome.org/gio/stable/GInputStream.html#g-input-stream-read-async
    
    Signed-off-by: Manuel Kaufmann <humitos@gmail.com>
    Acked-by: Simon Schampijer <simon@laptop.org>

39	28	src/jarabe/model/filetransfer.py

commit 52076ffdd0d7d107e86b7559955cc6a56fd3bc14
Author: Manuel Quiñones <manuq@laptop.org>
Date:   2012-12-17 09:13:54 -0300

    Journal: fix layout reordering for right-to-left languages - SL #4328
    
    This was introduced in the de-hippo move.  reverse() was a method of
    hippo.CanvasBox .  Now using Gtk boxes can do:
    
        for child in box.get_children():
            box.reorder_child(child, 0)

commit 69d57789feb2b5a2b07b8489f2511b4c8c8bd411
Author: Daniel Drake <dsd@laptop.org>
Date:   2012-12-11 10:02:48 +0000

    Modem device icon: fix state detection (#4255)
    
    Probably lacking an update from the NM-0.8 era, _update_state does
    not correctly handle NM_DEVICE_STATE_IP_CHECK and
    NM_DEVICE_STATE_SECONDARIES (triggered late in the connection-establishing
    process after NM_DEVICE_STATE_IP_CONFIG).
    
    This was causing backtraces like:
      File "/usr/share/sugar/extensions/deviceicon/network.py", line 856, in _update_state
        self._palette.update_state(gsm_state, reason)
      File "/usr/share/sugar/extensions/deviceicon/network.py", line 272, in update_state
        self._update_label_and_text(reason)
      File "/usr/share/sugar/extensions/deviceicon/network.py", line 310, in _update_label_and_text
        'text, %s' % str(self._current_state))
    ValueError: Invalid GSM state while updating label and text, None
    
    and it may have been confusing further code in the same class after.
    
    Fix _update_state to more accurately identify the "connecting" states.

1	1	extensions/deviceicon/network.py

commit af7b783866fb92d715d128f777ba3ae802949f7e
Author: Simon Schampijer <simon@laptop.org>
Date:   2012-12-13 19:50:56 +0100

    Tabbinghandler: port the tabbinghandler to the new GTK+3 API, SL #3895
    
    gdk-keyboard-grab [1] and gdk-pointer-grab [2] have been deprecated,
    we have to use gdk_device_grab [3] now in order to grab the events. This
    patch does the port to the new API.
    
    We also switch to gdk_window_get_device_position instead of
    gdk_window_get_pointer [4].
    
    This patch needs as well a fix for the keygrabber (toolkit) to handle
    XI2 key events in order to work.
    
    [1] http://developer.gnome.org/gdk3/stable/gdk3-General.html#gdk-keyboard-grab
    [2] http://developer.gnome.org/gdk3/stable/gdk3-General.html#gdk-pointer-grab
    [3] http://developer.gnome.org/gdk3/stable/GdkDevice.html#gdk-device-grab
    [4] http://developer.gnome.org/gdk3/stable/gdk3-Windows.html#gdk-window-get-pointer
    
    Signed-off-by: Simon Schampijer <simon@laptop.org>
    Reviewed-by: Gonzalo Odiard <gonzalo@laptop.org>
    Tested-by: Gonzalo Odiard <gonzalo@laptop.org>

38	13	src/jarabe/view/tabbinghandler.py

commit cb8b42ad069fbd067b4963c29993451b510b944d
Author: Simon Schampijer <simon@laptop.org>
Date:   2012-12-10 15:42:18 +0100

    Adapt to PaletteMenu changes for popdown on item activation, SL #4191 and SL #4253
    
    The toolkit now popdown the Palette when an
    item is activated. We do not have to do it manually
    any more.
    
    The Control Panel item code was setting the panel
    as transient on itself, this fails as the Palette
    vanishes after the item is activated. We are doing
    fine without setting the Control Panel transient on
    the Palette, which is wrong in any case.

commit 34fb1f8d948d0bc57334a7df94b8e1711f132912
Author: Manuel Kaufmann <humitos@gmail.com>
Date:   2012-12-05 10:11:53 -0300

    Screenshot extension: make sure we use a compatible cairo surface - SL #4104
    
    To create the screenshot surface, use
    gdk_window_create_similar_surface instead.  In toolkit
    (Activity.get_preview) we do the same.  It creates a more compatible
    surface.  Otherwise we are hardcoding the format, which showed to fail
    in XO-4 hardware.
    
    To set the window surface as the source surface on the new context,
    use gdk_cairo_set_source_window instead.  This way there is no need to
    create a new cairo context to get the surface, use the gdk window
    directly instead.
    
    Signed-off-by: Manuel Kaufmann <humitos@gmail.com>
    Signed-off-by: Manuel Quiñones <manuq@laptop.org>
    Acked-by: Simon Schampijer <simon@laptop.org>

4	4	extensions/globalkey/screenshot.py

    gtk-menu-item-remove-submenu has been deprecated use set_submenu instead

    GTK3 API for the GtkMenuItem [2].

commit f19a278e92e29d357409818a36116597b71f2e2f
Author: Manuel Quiñones <manuq@laptop.org>
Date:   2012-11-27 13:55:43 -0300

    Owner Icon: deactivate mouse over for the fist time - SL #4221
    
    The icons in all shell views have a grey rectangle background as mouse
    over feedback, but as the mouse pointer is set in the middle of the
    view when Sugar is initializated, we get the owner icon hovered, which
    we don't want.  This commit overrides that behaviour, in a similar way
    that is being done for the palette, in order to don't trigger it the
    fist time.
    
    Signed-off-by: Manuel Quiñones <manuq@laptop.org>
    Acked-by: Simon Schampijer <simon@laptop.org>

commit 4ae3bf07f1e6bbdd7b7f37fa770719e407c7b008
Author: Daniel Drake <dsd@laptop.org>
Date:   2012-11-23 13:11:02 -0500

    CP: allow further selection beyond English fallback
    
    Currently, the language control panel does not allow you to select
    other languages after a en_US entry. This is built around the assumption
    that source code strings are always in English, which is the common case,
    but does not always have to be true.
    
    As other apps can interpret the same LANGUAGE variable as a more general
    priority list of languages (Maliit will start doing this), there is
    further justification to remove the artificial en_US ending boundary.
    
    Acked-by: Simon Schampijer <simon@laptop.org>

commit 342d56d021606a84052913a00b810b451744535f
Author: Manuel Quiñones <manuq@laptop.org>
Date:   2012-11-15 17:39:25 -0300

    Journal details view: fix textviews can resize outside the window - SL #3941
    
    There is an inconsistent behaviour when a TextView with wrap mode
    WORD_CHAR is inside a ScrolledWindow with horizontal policy NEVER.  Is
    now reported upstream [1] with a testcase.  The solution is set the
    horizontal policy to AUTOMATIC.
    
    [1] https://bugzilla.gnome.org/show_bug.cgi?id=688472
    
    Signed-off-by: Manuel Quiñones <manuq@laptop.org>
    Acked-by: Simon Schampijer <simon@laptop.org>

Author: Simon Schampijer <simon@laptop.org>
Date:   2012-11-10 11:14:55 +0100

    Frame Palette interaction cleanup
    
    - add a 'done' signal to the CurrentActivityPalette
      that is emitted when on item in the Palette is
      selected, when received in the ActivitiesTray we
      do hide the Frame
    
    - call 'popdown_all' on the PaletteGroup when the
      Frame is hidden, this makes sure that all the
      Palettes are popped down in that case
    
    - Journal Palette: remove the popdown call when
      'show content' is selected, this introduced
      a race
    
    - this fixes as well SL #4171

commit 780a2b5a59d9f719ca7b3a126c973857c47ea4f0
Author: Manuel Quiñones <manuq@laptop.org>

    get_preferred* should be used instead.  So we need to implement
    do_get_preferred_size instead of do_size_request.

commit 54cf9e743f170ce19d131579033b9e14f481caaf
Author: Simon Schampijer <simon@laptop.org>
Date:   2012-11-08 18:34:08 +0100

    Frame Activity list: hide Frame after using an option in the Palette
    
    This does take care of the following cases:
    
    - resume an activity (or Journal) from the Palette
    - show the source code of an activity
    - stop an activity
    
    As we pop down the Palette after selecting one of
    the actions we can just listen on the popdown signal
    of the Palette and hide the Frame then.
    
    Signed-off-by: Simon Schampijer <simon@laptop.org>

commit f750863f81440f18245538796110cf00d58cc1b8
Author: Manuel Quiñones <manuq@laptop.org>
Date:   2012-11-07 15:32:14 -0300

    Buddy color: force bytestring encoding
    
    When the color is given by the remote buddy, it comes as unicode, even
    when the PropertiesChanged signal is connected with byte_arrays=True
    in jarabe/model/neighborhood.py.  The Rsvg.Handle.new_from_data method
    of toolkit needs a bytestring.  So we cast it to str.
    
    Signed-off-by: Manuel Quiñones <manuq@laptop.org>
    Acked-by: Simon Schampijer <simon@laptop.org>

1	1	src/jarabe/model/neighborhood.py

commit 5c8af547b22e392f1e147afab6b75bdc607ad4f5
Author: Daniel Narvaez <dwnarvaez@gmail.com>
Date:   2012-11-06 12:43:04 +0000

    Listen on a IntroWindow done signal instead of blocking
    
    Creating multiple non-nested mainloops in gtk 3.6 breaks
    at least accessibility.
    
    See https://bugzilla.gnome.org/show_bug.cgi?id=685453
    
    Signed-off-by: Daniel Narvaez <dwnarvaez@gmail.com>
    Acked-by: Simon Schampijer <simon@laptop.org>

Author: Daniel Narvaez <dwnarvaez@gmail.com>
Date:   2012-11-06 12:43:03 +0000

    Move IntroWindow creation to sugar-session
    
    It avoids the unexpected side effect (showing the intro UI
    implicityly when we are just checking the profile existence).
    
    It also prepares for listening to an IntroWindow done signal
    instead of blocking in a mainloop.
    
    Signed-off-by: Daniel Narvaez <dwnarvaez@gmail.com>

commit ccf965e462f3c3440e418949af7c4b750439ad50
Author: Simon Schampijer <simon@laptop.org>
Date:   2012-10-26 12:02:53 +0200

    Move Wireless Key dialog to an upper screen position, SL #4050
    
    In ebook mode the dialog would be obscured by the OSK
    otherwise.
    
    The y position is style.GRID_CELL_SIZE below the toolbar. The x
    value is centered based on the screen width. Using gtk-window-get-size
    we know the size of the dialog before it is on screen to do the
    calculation [1].
    
    [1] http://developer.gnome.org/gtk3/3.4/GtkWindow.html#gtk-window-get-size
    
    Signed-off-by: Simon Schampijer <simon@laptop.org>
    Acked-by: Manuel Quiñones <manuq@laptop.org>

6	0	src/jarabe/desktop/keydialog.py

commit a390ed68bb9df907aa362dd7c44b4776ba6f26a6
Author: Simon Schampijer <simon@laptop.org>
Date:   2012-10-16 15:33:18 +0200

    NetworkView: add the custom SugarPalette instead of the GTK.Menu based one, part of SL #3992
    
    The Gtk.Menu triggers a Palette popdown in a long press (and actually as well
    a long click). There is not realy a way around that so we go with our custom
    Palettes.
    
    This adds the custom Palette for the SugarAdhocView, the WirelessNetworkView
    and the OlpcMeshView.
    
    Use the toggle_palette property from the invoker in order to popup/popdown
    Palette on left click or tap.
    
    Fix appearance of AdHoc icons as well, error introduced
    in 02218ea3e0c4ac2edaa8b08dbc066f2d22f29e8a.
    
    Signed-off-by: Simon Schampijer <simon@laptop.org>
    Acked-by: Manuel Quiñones <manuq@laptop.org>

commit da5e3e0a76a7a9222a4a36d251aeff7c8d227f5b
Author: Simon Schampijer <simon@laptop.org>
Date:   2012-10-22 16:08:54 +0200

    Frame: use the new toggle_palette invoker property, SL #4065
    
    For the device icons, the friends icons and the clipboard ones
    we use the toggle_palette invoker property to achieve the
    following behavior: the Palette will popup/popdown on button
    left click/touch tap.
    
    The property has been added in c4165967d5e05607db8b3e0969b516da87855431
    to the toolkit.
    
    For the network device icons OlpcMeshDeviceView and WirelessDeviceView
    we do have to set an extra property to make this work. They are
    ToolButtons and not TrayIcons like the other icons. By default the
    toolbutton does popdown the Palette on a click.
    
    Signed-off-by: Simon Schampijer <simon@laptop.org>
    Acked-by: Manuel Quiñones <manuq@laptop.org>
